unnormalised: ## Yoga Practices: My Journey from Stiffness to Serenity
normalised: ## Yoga Practices: My Journey from Stiffness to Serenity

unnormalised: Okay, so I'm not going to pretend I’m some enlightened guru meditating in the Himalayas. My yoga journey started more like an awkward attempt to touch my toes, usually around 7:00 AM before the Mumbai heat really kicks in. For years, I dismissed yoga as something for flexible foreigners, until my back started screaming after sitting at a desk all day coding for Wipro.
normalised: Okay, so I'm not going to pretend I’m some enlightened guru meditating in the Himalayas. My yoga journey started more like an awkward attempt to touch my toes, usually around seven AM before the Mumbai heat really kicks in. For years, I dismissed yoga as something for flexible foreigners, until my back started screaming after sitting at a desk all day coding for Wipro.

unnormalised: That's when I reluctantly signed up for a beginner's class at the local studio, near Marine Drive. It was taught by a sweet lady named Anjali, who looked like she could bend into a pretzel without breaking a sweat. My first class on 05/05/2023 was brutal! My hamstrings cried out in protest during Downward Dog.

unnormalised: But Anjali was incredibly patient. She emphasized listening to my body and modifying poses. Slowly, something shifted. My back pain lessened. I started feeling stronger, more centered. Now, I can almost (almost!) touch my toes.
normalised: But Anjali was incredibly patient. She emphasized listening to my body and modifying poses. Slowly, something shifted. My back pain lessened. I started feeling stronger, more centered. Now, I can almost (almost!) touch my toes.

unnormalised: I've incorporated some simple Pranayama techniques, like Anulom Vilom, that really help calm my mind before important meetings at 02:00 PM. I also try to squeeze in a quick sun salutation sequence every morning after my chai. I am by no means an expert, but just doing 20 minutes daily has made such a massive difference.

unnormalised: And now, instead of dreading getting out of bed, I almost look forward to that little bit of time I carve out for myself on my yoga mat. Highly recommend giving it a try, even if you feel as stiff as an old jalebi like I did! Maybe I'll be doing headstands by 2025. Who knows?
